text: Prerequisites: HS50001Course ContentsAuctions: Where, how and why; Auction Types: Sealed-Bid, English, Dutch and other auction types, Reverse auctions, Single-object and multiple-object auctions, Sequential Auctions; Internet auctions; Auction Theory: First price auctions; Share auctions; Private value auctions; Common value auctions; Revenue Equivalence Principle and its extension to the cases of risk-aversion, budget constraints, and asymmetries, Auctions with Interdependent Values; Combinatorial auctions, and Optimal reserve prices in auctions; Imperfections in auctions: Collusion among bidders and between auctioneers and bidders Ã¢ÂÂ Detection and Prevention, Issues related to Scrutiny, Confidentiality, Non-repudiation and Privacy; Auctions versus negotiations; Negotiation Analysis: Fundamentals of decisions analysis, Behavioural decision theory, Game theory, Two parts win-lose and win-win negotiation, Multiparty negotiation.
